intro: Pyrrhanthera, commonly known as the golden rain vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Pyrrhanthera species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. These plants are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
